retirementIncome.baileyExemptionDescription: For NC state/local plans, you had 5+ years of service by Aug 12, 1989
retirementIncome.notes: Social Security and railroad retirement are fully exempt. Public pensions are exempt if Bailey-exempt; otherwise, taxable. Private pensions, IRAs, 401k, and annuities are fully taxable at the flat NC rate. Bailey exemption applies only to NC state/local plans with 5+ years of service by Aug 12, 1989.

retirementIncome.peaceOfficerPensionExclusionDescription: Licensed peace officers (police/firefighters) with 20+ years of service or job disability can fully exclude those pension benefits (from 2023)
retirementIncome.notes: Social Security and military retirement are fully exempt. All other retirement income is fully taxable. Peace officer/firefighter pension exclusion: TODO for user input/logic.
Social Security, Railroad, and Military pensions are fully exempt. Exclusion applies to other retirement income for 62+ or disabled, phased out from $100k to $150k AGI.

Social Security mostly exempt for 65+ if AGI ≤ $100k/$150k. Retirement income deduction $2,500 (under 65) or $8,000 (65+) if AGI within limits. Military retirement exempt up to $30,000. SB114 for non-SS-covered public pensions: TODO.

Social Security and public (government) pensions are fully exempt. Private pensions, IRAs, 401k, and annuities: up to $20,000 per person (or $40,000 joint) subtraction if age 59½+, remainder taxed at NY rates.
